Text A:
Effective Date: October 24, 2017

This Privacy Policy describes how AIP Publishing LLC (“AIP Publishing” or “we” or “us”) collects, uses, and discloses the information that we obtain through our Scitation website (www.scitation.org), eSpectra website (https://espectra.aip.org), Peer X-Press websites, and across the other online sites owned or operated by AIP Publishing that also link to this policy (the “Sites”). Please note that this Privacy Policy does not apply to information collected through third-party websites or services that you may access through the Sites.

Please review this Privacy Policy carefully. When you submit information to or through the Sites, you consent to the collection and processing of your information as described in this Privacy Policy. Unless otherwise stated herein, this Privacy Policy is made part of our Terms of Use. We encourage you to review our Terms of Use, which contains important information about our liability to you when you use the Sites.

If you do not agree with any part of this Privacy Policy, the Terms of Use or, in the case of eSpectra, the User Agreement, then please do not use our Sites.

Website-Specific Terms  
Information we collect  
The purpose in collecting Personal Information  
How Personal Information is shared  
Cookies and other data collection technologies  
Online advertising  
Your online choices  
Your access and opt-out rights  
How we protect your Personal Information  
Data integrity and purpose limitation  
Records retentionYour California rights  
User submissions  
Links and third-party websites  
Non-U.S. residents  
Notification of changes  
Contact information

Website-Specific Terms

eSpectra: If you use the eSpectra website, you accept the terms of this Privacy Policy, which is made part of the eSpectra User Agreement. If you have not done so already, please review our eSpectra User Agreement, which contains provisions specific to the eSpectra service. This Privacy Policy is expressly incorporated into the eSpectra User Agreement.

Peer X-Press: Peer X-Press (“PXP”) is AIP Publishing’s manuscript submission and peer review system. If you have registered for a PXP account, you will be asked to provide Personal Information such as your name, ORCID ID, email address, institutional affiliation, and country of residence. The primary purpose of gathering this information is to allow us to link a name and contact information to a user ID. The Personal Information that you provide to us via the PXP site, regardless of which journal you register with, is maintained in the Peer X-Press database. A single account enables you to submit or review a manuscript for any AIP Publishing journal. It also allows for information to be shared by the editorial offices in order to facilitate efficient transfers of manuscripts. Member Society PXP account information, however, is maintained in separate databases and is not shared outside of the individual society. If you are invited to review a manuscript, please be aware that although a reviewer's identity is never revealed to the author of the work itself, the report you provide, as well as your Personal Information, will be known to the editor and staff of any journal that considers the manuscript for publication. The same will hold true for an account that is created on your behalf when you are listed as a co-author for a manuscript submitted to an AIP Publishing or Member Society journal.

Other Sites: By using the Sites (other than eSpectra or PXP), you accept the terms of this Privacy Policy and our Terms of Use. If you have not done so already, please review our Terms of Use, which contain provisions that limit our liability to you. This Privacy Policy is expressly incorporated into our Terms of Use. Any specific privacy considerations in addition to this general policy will be noted where applicable.

Information we collect 

When you use our Sites, we may collect Personal Information that helps us identify you as an individual, as well as Personal Information about your use of the Sites. The information that we collect and how we use it depends on how you use and access the Sites.

Personal Information 

When using our Sites, we may collect personal information directly from you. “Personal Information” is any information that identifies an individual or relates to an identified individual, such as your name, mailing address, phone number, email address, or society membership details. We collect your Personal Information when you, for example, set up an account, register for a service, subscription or alert, obtain access to certain content, sign up for a newsletter, submit a Comment or post on a blog or public message board, make a purchase, or send an inquiry to our customer service team.

We may also collect your Personal Information from other organizations or individuals. For example, if you have registered with one of the Affiliated or Member Societies of the American Institute of Physics, and access to our Sites is part of that registration, we will receive your Personal Information from that Member Society to set up your account and provide you with access. If you are provided with a subscription to our Sites through your employer or organization, we may collect your Personal Information to set up your subscription. In addition, we may collect your Personal Information from other individuals when, for example, an author suggests you as a reviewer for his or her paper or invites you to register for one of our Sites. In these cases, we will send you an email to notify you that you have been suggested as a reviewer and/or instructions for how to register for our Sites.

We may provide an opportunity for you to share information with third-party social media services, such as by associating your social media account with our Sites. When you do so, these social media sites may give us access to certain Personal Information that they store. When you associate your social media account with our Sites, you agree that we may collect, use and store the information provided by that social media service as described in this Privacy Policy. When you visit our branded-social media pages, such as, on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook, we may collect the Personal Information you provide on those pages and treat that information in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

When you visit one of our Sites, Personal Information is automatically collected. For example, we use Google Analytics, which is a form of web measurement technology, to automatically track your interaction with our Sites and obtain insight into our website traffic and the effectiveness of our marketing. The types of Personal Information collected automatically may include but are not limited to your internet domain and IP address, the URL address of the previous website you visited, the URL addresses of the webpages that you visited on our Sites, your browser and operating system type, whether you completed certain tasks or were successful in your online requests while on the Sites, or the date and time of your visit.

We may store and share this Personal Information among one or more of our internal databases and create an archival copy for recordkeeping and internal purposes. We also may enhance the data we collect with other information from third-party sources.

The purpose in collecting Personal Information 

We primarily use the Personal Information we collect in an effort to improve your experience on the Sites, to provide you with services and Content, and to communicate with you about information that you request. We may also use your Personal Information to help us do the following:

  * To operate, improve and personalize the products and services we offer, and provide you with a more consistent and personalized experience when interacting with us.
  * To enable customer service, security, enforce our Terms of Service, and to detect fraud or illegal activities.
  * To create account efficiencies, such as a single customer record, and to eliminate redundancies and duplication.
  * To communicate with you, such as to relay important administrative and transactional announcements about the Sites or your account.
  * To conduct surveys and questionnaires about our Sites and the services we offer.
  * To improve the overall efficiency, security, and functionality of the site to make your visit more productive.
  * To provide you with editorial, marketing, and advertising that we think are relevant to your areas of interest, including materials from our third-party business partners.
  * To conduct research and analysis.
  * To analyze and report on website usage.



How Personal Information is shared

We may share your Personal Information for the reason(s) disclosed to you at the time that we collect your Personal Information and in the following ways:

  * At your direction: We will share your Personal Information with third parties when you tell us to. For example, if you fill out a form provided by one of our third-party sponsors or advertisers, we will provide that information to them for their own use.
  * With related entities: We may disclose Personal Information to the American Institute of Physics (AIP Publishing’s parent), Affiliated or Member Societies of the American Institute of Physics, and subsidiaries or related companies owned by AIP Publishing.
  * With our service providers: We share your information with our service providers that perform and offer services on our behalf. This allows us to enable specific services and functionality for which we have contracted or partnered, such as customizing our products or services, sending marketing and communications related to our business, payment processing, and improving our Sites. AIP Publishing is responsible for subsequent transfers to a third party acting as an agent on our behalf.
  * For legal purposes: We may disclose your Personal Information to government authorities or third parties, as needed within our reasonable judgment, to identify fraud, to protect and enforce our rights or the rights of our customers or related entities, in response to a subpoena, regulation or other legal process, and when required by law.
  * During corporate changes: We may transfer your Personal Information in the event of a merger, sale, acquisition or other change of ownership or control of our company (whether in whole or in part).



Cookies and other data collection technologies

AIP Publishing uses cookies, which are files that are placed on your computer when you first visit a webpage. Cookies allow you to move through the Site more smoothly and enhance your user experience by making it more seamless. They also allow us to record information when you revisit our Sites, retain your customized preferences, and deliver advertisements to you that are tailored to your interests.

AIP Publishing also uses the following types of data collection technologies:

  * Session cookies: Session cookies are designed so that once you close your browser, the cookie will simply terminate. They help you navigate the Site by acting like placeholders or bookmarks to temporarily store information. Session cookies assist you in performing functions such as filling your shopping cart.
  * Persistent cookies: Persistent cookies are permanent and remain on your computer after you terminate your session. Your ability to customize settings based on your own preferences is dependent on persistent cookies. Each time you return to our Site, for example, persistent cookies allow us to identify you as a returning user, so that you don’t have to re-enter information that you’ve already provided.
  * Third-party cookies: AIP Publishing uses third-party cookies to enable our trusted partners to bring increased functionality to our Site. For example, AIP Publishing has partnered with a service that allows for the collection of usage data for our own marketing purposes. The information we obtain may be used to offer you assistance, to help us make improvements to the website, or to send you special offers that relate to the content you’ve viewed.
  * Web beacons: Web beacons, or single pixel gifs, are a form of tracking technology that record user behavior. We use web beacons on our Site and in emails we may send to you to collect information such as whether you opened a web page or email, your IP address, the type of browser you used, etc. This information allows us to measure the effectiveness of our campaigns, to target specific content only to those who are most interested, and to improve our features and your overall user experience.
  * Do Not Track: Some web browsers incorporate a Do Not Track (“DNT”) or similar feature that signals to digital services that a user does not want to have his/her online activity tracked. If a digital service that responds to a particular DNT signal receives the DNT signal, the browser can block that digital service from collecting certain information about that browser’s user. Not all browsers offer a DNT option and DNT signals are not yet uniform. For this reason, we and many other digital service operators do not respond to DNT signals. For more information about DNT signals, visit http://allaboutdnt.com.  



Online advertising 

We may contract with third-party remarketing services, such as Google AdWords, to tailor advertising to our users. Through the use of cookies, Google Adwords tracks what parts of our Site you visited in order to serve you relevant ads on other websites you visit as you navigate across the Internet. This ensures you only receive content that is of interest to you. Please understand that if you disable cookies (as discussed below) to prevent such interest-based advertising, you may still see advertisements – they just will not be tailored to your interests.

Your online choices

You can control what types of cookies you wish to allow, delete, or disable through the settings in your browser. If you restrict cookies, however, you may not obtain the optimum benefit of the Sites’ functionality or be able to access all of its content.

  * If you would like to opt out of participating in Google AdWords Remarketing, please visit Google’s Ads Settings.
  * To prevent information from being collected by Google Analytics, you can install the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on.
  * To opt out of any third-party vendor's use of cookies, please visit networkadvertising.org/choices/.
  * More information about the nature of cookies and how they work may also be found at allaboutcookies.org.



Your access and opt-out rights

AIP Publishing strives to make sure that our information is reliable, accurate, and up-to-date. While Personal Information is maintained by AIP Publishing, you may access the Personal Information that we have collected directly from you to the extent required by law to review, update, and correct inaccuracies. You can also visit your account to manage and correct the Personal Information we have on file for you. Upon request made to the contact listed below under the section titled “Contact information,” we will provide You with reasonable access to the Personal Information we have collected from You. If you contact us directly we will take reasonable steps to confirm your identity before making any changes. Because Personal information—for example, your email address—is required to use the Site, we retain certain Personal Information as long as your account is active. You will have the opportunity to correct, transfer, update, modify, or delete this information by logging into Your account and updating Your Personal Information online. Please note that some information may remain in our records even after You request deletion of Your Personal Information, to the extent permitted by applicable laws. Additionally, there may be limits to the amount of information we can practically provide. For example, we may limit access to Personal Information where the burden or expense of providing access would be disproportionate to the risks to an individual's privacy or where doing so would violate others' rights. 

If you wish to opt-out of having your Personal Information used for advertising or marketing purposes, or to remove your information from any list that might be sold or given to another organization, please send a request to help@scitation.org. You may also unsubscribe from our marketing emails that you receive from us at any time by clicking the “unsubscribe” link at the bottom of the email or by sending your request to help@scitation.org. Please note that unsubscribing from marketing communications shall not limit our ability to send transactional communications to you regarding products or services you have requested.

How we protect your Personal Information

AIP Publishing takes reasonable and appropriate steps to protect and prevent unauthorized access to your Personal Information and to ensure the integrity of that information.

While AIP Publishing continually monitors the security status of its networks, it cannot guarantee that any transmission of data made over the Internet is totally secure. You have a responsibility as well to help protect the information you provide by keeping your account information confidential and not using unsecured or unencrypted networks.

Data integrity and purpose limitation

AIP Publishing limits the use of Personal Information to ways that are compatible and relevant for which the Personal Information was collected or subsequently authorized or for which consent was obtained. We will take reasonable steps to ensure that Personal Information is reliable for its intended use, accurate, complete, and current.

Records retention

AIP Publishing will retain Your Personal Information as needed to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected. AIP Publishing will retain and use Your Personal Information as necessary to comply with our business requirements, legal obligations, resolve disputes, protect our assets, and enforce our agreements.

Your California rights

If you are a California resident, you may request information (once per calendar year) regarding whether we disclosure of your Personal Information to our affiliates and to third parties for those third parties’ direct marketing purposes. To make such a request, please send an email to rights@aip.org or write us:

CA Privacy Rights  
AIP Publishing LLC  
1305 Walt Whitman Road  
Suite 300  
Melville, NY 11747

User submissions

The Sites may offer users the opportunity to submit, publish or share comments, reviews, and other content (“User Content”). Personal Information in User Content may be available to others and may be used in unexpected ways. You submit your User Content at your own risk, and we may access and use your User Content consistent with this Privacy Policy. By communicating with any other user on the Sites you explicitly “Opt-In” to sharing such information, which may include Personal Information, with that user. To request removal of User Content, please contact us at rights@aip.org. If we are unable to remove your User Content we will let you know the reasons why.

Links and third-party websites

AIP Publishing Sites contain links to other websites, and other websites link to our Sites. Please be aware that AIP Publishing is not responsible for the privacy practices of other third-party websites that we do not operate or control, and this Privacy Policy does not apply to the information collected by third parties through their websites. We encourage you to be aware when you leave our Sites and to read the privacy statements of each of the website that you visit.

Non-U.S. residents

If you reside outside the United States, please be aware that any information you provide to us, including Personal Information, will be transferred to, collected, processed, and stored in the United States. Privacy and data protection laws differ from country to country, and the laws in the United States may offer less protection than the laws of your country. When you provide your information to us, you consent to the processing of your data in, and the transfer of your data to, the United States.

Notification of changes 

The Effective Date of this Privacy Policy is set forth at the top of this page. Whenever possible, we will provide you with advance notice of any material changes to this Privacy Policy. We will not make retroactive changes that reduce your privacy rights unless we are legally required to do so. Your continued use of the Sites after the Effective Date constitutes your acceptance of the amended Privacy Policy, which will replace and supersede all previous versions. Please review this page regularly for updates as well as any notification of changes posted to the Sites.

Contact information

If you have and questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or how we use your information, please contact us at:

AIP Publishing LLC

1305 Walt Whitman Road

Suite 300

Melville, NY 11747

1-516-576-2200

rights@aip.org

If AIP Publishing needs, or is required, to contact you concerning any event that involves information about you we may do so by email, telephone, or mail.
Text B:
Effective on: May 24, 2018

This Privacy Policy describes how AIP Publishing LLC (“AIP Publishing” or “we” or “us”) collects, uses, and discloses the information that we obtain through our Scitation website (www.scitation.org), eSpectra website (http://espectra.aip.org), Peer X-Press websites, and the other online sites owned or operated by AIP Publishing that also link to this policy (the “Sites”), as well as information that we obtain offline. Please note that this Privacy Policy does not apply to information collected through third-party websites or services that you access through the Sites.

Please review this Privacy Policy carefully. When you submit information to or through the Sites, you consent to the collection and processing of your information as described in this Privacy Policy. Unless otherwise stated here, this Privacy Policy is made part of our Terms of Use. We encourage you to review our Terms of Use, which contains important information about our liability to you when you use the Sites.

If you do not agree with any part of this Privacy Policy, the Terms of Use, or, in the case of eSpectra, the User Agreement, then please do not use our Sites. Any specific privacy considerations in addition to this general policy will be noted where applicable.

Website-specific terms  
Information we collect  
The purpose in collecting Personal Information  
How Personal Information is shared  
Cookies and other data collection technologies  
Online advertising  
Your online choices  
Your access, rectification, deletion, and opt-out rights  
How we protect your Personal Information  
Data integrity and purpose limitation  
Records retention  
Your California rights  
User submissions  
Links and third-party websites  
Non-U.S. residents  
Notification of changes  
Contact information

Website-specific terms

While the Privacy Policy describes AIP Publishing’s general privacy practices, the websites below have the following unique practices that diverge from the practices described elsewhere in the policy:

eSpectra: If you use the eSpectra website, you accept the terms of this Privacy Policy, which is made part of the eSpectra User Agreement. If you have not done so already, please review our eSpectra User Agreement, which contains provisions specific to the eSpectra service. This Privacy Policy is expressly incorporated into the eSpectra User Agreement.

Peer X-Press: Peer X-Press (“PXP”) is AIP Publishing’s manuscript submission and peer review system. If you have registered for a PXP account, you will be asked to provide Personal Information, such as your name, ORCID number, email address, institutional affiliation, and country of residence. The primary purpose of gathering this information is to allow us to link a name and contact information to a user ID.

The Personal Information that you provide to us via the PXP site, regardless of which journal you register with, is maintained in the Peer X-Press database. A single account enables you to submit or review a manuscript for any AIP Publishing journal. It also allows for information to be shared by the editorial offices to facilitate efficient transfers of manuscripts. Member Society PXP account information, however, is maintained in separate databases and is not shared outside of the individual society.

If you are invited to review a manuscript, please be aware that although a reviewer's identity is never revealed to the author of the work itself, the report you provide, as well as your Personal Information, will be known to the editor and staff of any journal that considers the manuscript for publication. The same will hold true for an account that is created on your behalf when you are listed as a co-author for a manuscript submitted to an AIP Publishing or Member Society journal.

PXP is an online manuscript submission and peer review system, not a general website. While our Privacy Policy describes our general practices regarding the Personal Information obtained through our other websites, the Personal Information obtained through the PXP site is not shared with third parties other than our service providers to facilitate the peer review process, and, as stated above, with journal editorial offices and staff when manuscripts are transferred. We also do not market to PXP users without their express consent.

Information we collect 

When you use our Sites, we collect Personal Information that helps us identify you as an individual, as well as Personal Information about your use of the Sites. The information that we collect and how we use it depends on how you use and access the Sites. We also collect Personal Information from you regarding the activities described on the Sites when you voluntarily send it to us outside of the Sites or offline. Such information shall be treated as Personal Information submitted through the Sites and in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

Personal Information 

When you use our Sites, we collect Personal Information directly from you. “Personal Information” is any information that identifies an individual or relates to an identifiable individual, such as your name, mailing address, phone number, email address, or society membership details. We collect your Personal Information when you, for example, set up an account; register for a service, subscription, or alert; obtain access to certain content; sign up for a newsletter; submit a Comment or post on a blog or public message board; make a purchase; or send an inquiry to our customer service team.

We also collect your Personal Information from other organizations or individuals. For example, if you have registered with one of the Affiliated or Member Societies of the American Institute of Physics and access to our Sites is part of that registration, we will receive your Personal Information from that Member Society to set up your account and provide you with access. If you are provided with a subscription to our Sites through your employer or organization, we collect your Personal Information to set up your subscription. In addition, we collect your Personal Information from other individuals when, for example, an author suggests you as a reviewer for his or her paper or invites you to register for one of our Sites. In these cases, we will send you an email to notify you that you have been suggested as a reviewer and/or instructions for registering on our Sites.

We also provide an opportunity for you to share information with third-party social media services, such as by associating your social media account with our Sites. When you do so, these social media sites give us access to certain Personal Information that they store. When you associate your social media account with our Sites, you agree that we will collect, use, and store the information provided by that social media service as described in this Privacy Policy. When you visit our branded social media pages, such as on Twitter, LinkedIn, and Facebook, we collect the Personal Information you provide on those pages and treat that information in accordance with this Privacy Policy.

When you visit our Sites, Personal Information is automatically collected. For example, we use Google Analytics, which is a form of web measurement technology, to automatically track your interaction with our Sites and obtain insight into our website traffic and the effectiveness of our marketing. The type of Personal Information collected automatically includes but is not limited to your Internet domain and IP address, the URL address of the previous website you visited, the URL addresses of the webpages that you visited on our Sites, your browser and operating system type, whether you completed certain tasks or were successful in your online requests while on the Sites, and the date and time of your visit.

We will store and share this Personal Information among one or more of our internal databases and create an archival copy for record keeping and internal purposes. We also may enhance the data we collect with other information from third-party sources.

The purpose in collecting Personal Information 

We primarily use the Personal Information we collect to improve your use of the Sites, to communicate with you about information that you request, and to help us do the following:

  * Operate the Sites effectively, deliver our products and services, and provide you with a more consistent and personalized experience when interacting with us.
  * Perform timely customer service and communicate important administrative and transactional announcements about the Sites or your account.
  * Create account efficiencies, such as a single customer record, and eliminate redundancies and duplication.
  * Enforce our Terms of Service and detect fraud or illegal activities.
  * Conduct surveys and questionnaires about our Sites and the services we offer.
  * Improve the overall security and functionality of the Sites to make your visit safer and more productive.
  * Provide you with editorial, marketing, and advertising information that we think is relevant to your areas of interest, including materials from our third-party business partners. We won’t share your Personal Information with these companies but will send you the information on their behalf.
  * Enable research and promote the innovation of our products and services.
  * Analyze and report on website usage.



How Personal Information is shared

We will share your Personal Information only for the reason(s) disclosed to you at the time that we collect it and in the following ways:

  * At your direction: We will share your Personal Information with third parties when you tell us to. For example, if you fill out a form provided by one of our third-party sponsors or advertisers, we will provide that information to them for their own use.
  * With related entities: We may disclose Personal Information to the American Institute of Physics (AIP Publishing’s parent), Affiliated or Member Societies of the American Institute of Physics, and subsidiaries or related companies owned by AIP Publishing. A list of related entities can be found at https://www.aip.org/member-societies.
  * With our service providers: We share your information with our service providers that perform and offer services on our behalf. This allows us to enable specific services and functionality for which we have contracted or partnered, such as customizing our products or services, sending marketing and communications related to our business, payment processing, and improving our Sites. AIP Publishing is responsible for subsequent transfers to a third party acting as an agent on our behalf.
  * For legal purposes: We will disclose your Personal Information to government authorities or third parties, as needed within our reasonable judgment, to identify fraud; to protect and enforce our rights or the rights of our customers or related entities; in response to a subpoena, regulation, or other legal process; and when required by law.
  * During corporate changes: We will transfer your Personal Information in the event of a merger, sale, acquisition, or other change of ownership or control of our company (whether in whole or in part).



Cookies and other data collection technologies

AIP Publishing uses cookies, which are files that are placed on your computer when you first visit a webpage. Cookies allow you to move through the Sites more smoothly and enhance your user experience by making it more seamless. They also allow us to record information when you revisit our Sites, retain your customized preferences, and deliver advertisements to you that are tailored to your interests.

AIP Publishing also uses the following types of data collection technologies:

  * Session cookies: Session cookies are designed so that once you close your browser, the cookie will simply terminate. They help you navigate the Sites by acting like placeholders or bookmarks to temporarily store information. Session cookies assist you in performing functions such as filling your shopping cart.
  * Persistent cookies: Persistent cookies are permanent and remain on your computer after you terminate your session. Your ability to customize settings based on your own preferences is dependent on persistent cookies. Each time you return to our Sites, for example, persistent cookies allow us to identify you as a returning user so that you don’t have to re-enter information that you’ve already provided.
  * Third-party cookies: AIP Publishing uses third-party cookies to enable our trusted partners to bring increased functionality to our Sites. For example, AIP Publishing has partnered with a service that enables the collection of usage data for our own marketing purposes. The information we obtain is used to offer you assistance, to help us make improvements to the website, or to send you special offers that relate to the content you’ve viewed.
  * Web beacons: Web beacons, or single-pixel gifs, are a form of tracking technology that records user behavior. We use web beacons on our Sites and in emails we send to you to collect information such as whether you opened a web page or email, your IP address, the type of browser you used, etc. This information allows us to measure the effectiveness of our campaigns, target specific content only to those who are most interested, and improve our features and your overall user experience.
  * Do Not Track: Some web browsers incorporate a Do Not Track (“DNT”) or similar feature that signals to digital services that a user does not want to have his/her online activity tracked. If a digital service that responds to a particular DNT signal receives the DNT signal, the browser can block that digital service from collecting certain information about that browser’s user. Not all browsers offer a DNT option and DNT signals are not yet uniform. For these reasons, we and many other digital service operators do not respond to DNT signals. For more information about DNT signals, visit http://allaboutdnt.com.  



Online advertising 

We contract with third-party remarketing services, such as Google AdWords, to tailor advertising to our users. Using cookies, these services track what parts of our Sites you visited in order to serve you relevant ads on other websites you visit as you navigate across the Internet. This ensures you receive only content that is of interest to you. Please understand that if you disable cookies (as discussed below) to prevent such interest-based advertising, you will still see advertisements – but they will not be tailored to your interests.

Your online choices

You can control what types of cookies you wish to allow, delete, or disable through the settings in your browser. If you restrict cookies, however, you will not obtain the optimum benefit of the Sites’ functionality or be able to access all of the content. In addition, we participate in behavior-based advertising. This means that a third party uses technology (e.g., a cookie) to collect information about your use of our website so that they can provide advertising about products and services tailored to your interests. That advertising appears on either our websites or other websites. You can opt out of receiving advertising based upon your browsing behavior from some of the network advertising companies that deploy cookies on some of our websites by going to the Network Advertising Initiative website at www.networkadvertising.org/choices/. You can also use the following links to opt-out of advertising based on the following tracking cookies:

  * If you would like to opt out of participating in Google AdWords Remarketing, please visit Google’s Ads Settings.
  * To prevent information from being collected by Google Analytics, you can install the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on.



Your access, rectification, deletion, and opt-out rights

AIP Publishing strives to make sure that the information we maintain is reliable, accurate, and up to date.

You can log into your account online to correct, update, or modify some of your information at any time. If you choose to delete your profile online, note that while your profile will become inactive, we continue to maintain personal information about you.

Upon request made to dataprivacy@aip.org, we will provide you with a copy of the Personal Information we hold about you to the extent required by law. You may also request that your Personal Information be updated, corrected, transferred, deleted, or that processing be restricted or discontinued by contacting us at that email address. If you contact us directly, we will take reasonable steps to confirm your identity before making any changes. Because Personal information — for example, your email address — is required to use the Sites, we retain certain Personal Information as long as your account is active. Please note that some information remains in our records even after you request its deletion, to the extent permitted by applicable laws. Additionally, there are limits to the amount of information we can practically provide. For example, we will limit access to Personal Information where the burden or expense of providing access would be disproportionate to the risks to an individual's privacy or where doing so would violate others' rights. 

If you wish to opt-out of having your Personal Information used for advertising or marketing purposes, or to remove your information from any list that might be shared with another organization consistent with this Privacy Policy, please send a request to help@scitation.org. You may also unsubscribe from the marketing emails that you receive from us at any time by clicking the “unsubscribe” link at the bottom of the email or by sending your request to help@scitation.org. If you unsubscribe from marketing communications, however, it will not limit our ability to send transactional communications to you regarding products or services you have requested.

How we protect your Personal Information

AIP Publishing takes reasonable and appropriate steps to protect and prevent unauthorized access to your Personal Information and to ensure the integrity of that information.

While AIP Publishing continually monitors the security status of its networks, it cannot guarantee that any transmission of data made over the Internet is totally secure. You have a responsibility as well to help protect the information you provide by keeping your account information confidential and not using unsecured or unencrypted networks.

Data integrity and purpose limitation

AIP Publishing limits the use of Personal Information to ways that are compatible and relevant to the purposes for which the Personal Information was collected or subsequently authorized or for which consent was obtained. We will take reasonable steps to ensure that Personal Information is reliable for its intended use, accurate, complete, and current.

Records retention

AIP Publishing will retain your Personal Information as needed to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected. AIP Publishing will retain and use your Personal Information as necessary to comply with our business requirements and legal obligations, resolve disputes, protect our assets, and enforce our agreements.

Your California rights

If you are a California resident, you may request information (once per calendar year) regarding whether we disclosed your Personal Information to our affiliates and to third parties for those third parties’ direct marketing purposes. To make such a request, please send an email to dataprivacy@aip.org or write us:

CA Privacy Rights  
AIP Publishing LLC  
1305 Walt Whitman Road  
Suite 300  
Melville, NY 11747

User submissions

The Sites may offer users the opportunity to submit, publish, or share comments, reviews, and other content (“User Content”). Personal Information in User Content is viewable by others and can be used in unexpected ways. You submit your User Content at your own risk, and we will access and use your User Content consistent with this Privacy Policy. By communicating with any other user on the Sites, you explicitly “Opt In” to sharing such information, which includes Personal Information, with that user. To request removal of User Content, please contact us at dataprivacy@aip.org. If we are unable to remove your User Content, we will let you know the reasons why.

Links and third-party websites

AIP Publishing Sites contain links to other websites, and other websites link to our Sites. Please be aware that AIP Publishing is not responsible for the privacy practices of third-party websites that we do not operate or control, and this Privacy Policy does not apply to the information collected by third parties through their websites. We encourage you to be aware when you leave our Sites and to read the privacy statements of each of the websites that you visit.

Non-U.S. residents

If you reside outside the United States, please be aware that any information you provide to us, including Personal Information, will be transferred to, collected, processed, and stored in the United States. Privacy and data protection laws differ from country to country, and the laws in the United States may offer less protection than the laws of your country. When you provide your information to us, you consent to the processing of your data in, and the transfer of your data to, the United States.

Notification of changes 

The effective date of this Privacy Policy is set forth at the top of this page. Whenever possible, we will provide you with notice of any material changes to this Privacy Policy. Your continued use of the Sites after the effective date constitutes your acceptance of the amended Privacy Policy, which will replace and supersede all previous versions. We will send you periodic reminders to review this page for updates and notifications of changes posted to the Sites.

Contact information

If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or how we use your information, please contact us at:

AIP Publishing LLC  
1305 Walt Whitman Road  
Suite 300  
Melville, NY 11747  
1-516-576-2200  
dataprivacy@aip.org

Legal entity that can receive items in Europe relating to AIP Publishing’s processing of information:

AIP Publishing  
c/o Bryan Cave Leighton Paisner LLP  
Attn: Erik Kahn - NY  
Adelaide House London Bridge  
London, United Kingdom  
EC4R 9HA

We will investigate and attempt to resolve complaints and disputes regarding use and disclosure of your Personal Information in accordance with this Privacy Policy. If you are a data subject in the European Union, and you have an unresolved concern regarding your Personal Information that we have not addressed satisfactorily, you may also contact your local data protection authority.

If AIP Publishing needs or is required to contact you concerning any event that involves information about you, we will do so by email, telephone, or mail.

Text A:
> ###  Privacy Policy
> 
> Pete's Power Point Station (pppst) does not collect information on visitors to its Website. This is, perhaps, all a visitor or parent needs to know since it covers everything. To fulfill federal legislative requirements, we are making additional specific statements below. This policy follows the privacy policy model provided by Awesome Library with their permission.
> 
> ###  Privacy Policy Regarding Children
> 
> Pete's Power Point Station (pppst) does not:
> 
> Collect online contact information from a child under 13.   If Pete's Power Point Station (pppst) ever does collect such information, it will gain prior verifiable parental consent or direct parental notification of the nature and intended use of this information, which shall include an opportunity for the parent to prevent use of the information and participation in the activity.   Where prior parental consent is not obtained,online contact information shall only be used to directly respond to the child's request and shall not be used to re-contact the child for other purposes. Emails from children are not saved after responding to their questions.
> 
> Pete's Power Point Station (pppst) does not:
> 
> Collect personally identifiable offline contact information from children under 13 without prior verifiable parental consent.
> 
> Pete's Power Point Station (pppst) does not:
> 
> Distribute to third parties any Personally Identifiable Information collected from a child under 13 without prior verifiable parental consent.
> 
> Give the ability to children under 13 to publicly post or otherwise distribute personally identifiable contact information without prior verifiable parental consent, and will make best efforts to prohibit a child from posting any contact information.
> 
> Entice a child under 13 by the prospect of a special game, prize or other activity, to divulge more information than is needed to participate in such activity. 
> 
> If pppst.org ever requests personally identifiable information, we will also place prominent notice where personally identifiable information is collected, requesting the child to ask a parent for permission to answer the questions.
> 
> ###  Privacy Policy Regarding Adults
> 
> Pete's Power Point Station (pppst) does not:
> 
> Collect personally identifible information.   If it does begin collecting such information, prior consent will be obtained from the users of the site, options will be provided to not provide such information, and the uses of the information will be specified.   If information will be divulged to third parties, users will be notified prior to collecting the information.

Text A:
Effective April 4, 2008

To provide you with superior service, Primo Water Corporation and its subsidiaries ("Primo," "we" or "us") may collect certain personal information from you when you visit our website. When you submit this information, it will help us to provide you with faster personalized service and it may allow you to access certain promotions, special offers and information about new products and services. We recognize, however, and are committed to protecting, your need for privacy and security as you visit our website.

To demonstrate this commitment, we created this privacy and security statement (this "Statement") to explain to you our online information gathering and dissemination practices and to inform you about the choices you can make about the way such information is collected and used. We reserve the right to change this Statement at any time. Please take a few minutes to read this Statement so you can understand how information is used and the specific measures we take to protect your personal information.

This Statement covers the collection, use, and disclosure of personal information that may be collected by us anytime you interact with us by visiting our website, purchasing our products or when interacting with a Primo customer service representative.

Collection of Personally Identifiable Information  
Generally, no personally identifiable information, such as your name or mailing address, will be collected by us when you visit the our website, nor is its submission required for you to visit our website. Occasionally, Primo may offer website programs such as contests, sweepstakes, promotions, surveys, or online services. To participate in these programs, you must have a valid e-mail and mailing address, and you may be required to provide personal information (which may include, but not be limited to, your name, password, telephone numbers, email addresses, mailing addresses, demographic information, and other data) (collectively, "Personal Information"). In addition, there are portions of this website where we may need to collect Personal Information from you for a specific purpose, such as to provide you with information requested by you. We will not collect any Personal Information about you unless you voluntarily provide it to us. Your decision to provide such information and participate in such programs will be entirely voluntary.

Use of Personal Information  
Primo will be the sole owner of all Personal Information collected through the programs referred to in the preceding paragraph and this website. If you decide to voluntarily provide Primo with Personal Information in relation to one of our website programs, we will store such information in protected databases on secured servers with restricted access.

When Personal Information is collected from you, we will let you know how we will use the Personal Information. In addition to our website and programs, we may use the Personal Information you provide to respond to your inquiry or to process your request for information. Primo will not share or sell your Personal Information with any third party for its marketing use. We may share your Personal Information with other companies we have hired to provide us with specific services. Your Personal Information will only be used by these third parties (or their subcontractors) to perform the assigned services for which they were hired.

Also, through a hosting company for our website, we may collect certain additional information from you as a visitor to our website, such as Internet addresses and browser version and type. This information may be logged by us or our hosting company to help diagnose technical problems, and to administer the website in order to improve the quality of our service. We may also track and analyze non-identifying information and aggregate usage and volume statistical information from our visitors and customers and provide such anonymous statistical information to third parties. It may not be readily apparent that this information is being collected. If you would like to find out more about the privacy practices of our hosting company, please contact us using the contact information provided below and we will provide you with the name of, and contact information for our current hosting company. With your permission, we may use your contact information to send you information about Primo and related products and services. You can always opt-out of these communications.

Opting Out of Information Collection  
Our website allows visitors to opt-out of receiving communication when we request Personal Information from you, or through other means as identified. You may opt-out of providing Personal Information by simply not providing such information or by discontinuing the use of our website, or those portions of our website that require you to submit Personal Information. To ensure immediate removal from any of our electronic mailing lists, follow the specific instructions outlined within the communication you receive from us. If, however, you are unable to complete the process described in the communication, please send a copy of the undesired email to the address below and state that you wish to be removed from the mailing list.

You may review, update, modify or remove your Personal Information provided to us at any time. Simply mail a detailed request to the address below.

Usage Restrictions for Children  
The Primo website is not intended for persons under 13 years of age. Primo does not knowingly collect or intend to collect Personal Information from children through our website in any circumstance. Please do not allow children to provide such information or participate in any of our website programs. If you become aware that this has occurred, please contact us at the address below to request the deletion of that information.

Third Party Websites  
Primo may partner with retailers, manufacturers, or other companies at various times to provide expanded services to our website guests. As part of such a relationship, Primo may share with these companies the use of certain website functions and/or information, and our website may contain links to such partner's sites. Primo is not responsible for the privacy practices or the content of any third party websites. Primo website visitors that link to other websites from the Primo site will need to check the privacy and security policy statement of such third party websites in order to understand such third party's privacy and security policies.

Certain Disclosures of Personal Information  
If Primo sells or transfers part or all of its business assets, consumer information may be one of the business assets transferred as part of the transaction. Primo may disclose Personal Information in special cases when it believes that disclosure of this information is necessary to comply with or conform to the law or that such disclosure is necessary to protect the users of our website, the website itself, or the public.

The Primo website may provide chat rooms, forums, message boards, and/or news groups to its users at various times. Please remember that, unless otherwise stated, any information you disclose in these areas becomes public information. Primo is not responsible for such disclosures. Please exercise caution.

Cookies  
Primo may use a browser feature known as a "cookie," which are small files sent from our website to your computer. Cookies save non-personal information that enhances your use of our website. Cookies do not contain Personal Information and do not identify you personally. They merely recognize your browser. Cookies can be disabled or flagged by your browser. Please refer to the help feature in your browser software for more information. Note - disabling cookies may negatively affect the performance of the Primo website.

Primo also tracks certain navigational information about where you go on our website. This information helps us to determine the most popular and least popular areas of our website so we can provide you with the best website possible. This information is only gathered collectively and is not associated with a specific individual, and it may not be readily apparent that this information is being collected. This type of information may occasionally be provided to third parties to demonstrate interest in our site and to help us administer the website.

Privacy Statement Revisions  
This Statement is subject to change without notice as our website is enhanced and as Internet privacy standards evolve. To ensure that you are fully informed about how your Personal Information may be used, our Statement will always be available for review on our website.
Text B:

To provide you with superior service, Primo Water Corporation and its subsidiaries ("Primo," "we" or "us") may collect certain personal information from you when you visit our website. Use of Personal Information  
Primo will be the sole owner of all Personal Information collected through the programs referred to in the preceding paragraph and this website. If you decide to voluntarily provide Primo with Personal Information in relation to one of our website programs, we will store such information in protected databases on secured servers with restricted access.

When Personal Information is collected from you, we will let you know how we will use the Personal Information. In addition to our website and programs, we may use the Personal Information you provide to respond to your inquiry or to process your request for information. Primo will not share or sell your Personal Information with any third party for its marketing use. We may share your Personal Information with other companies we have hired to provide us with specific services. Your Personal Information will only be used by these third parties (or their subcontractors) to perform the assigned services for which they were hired.

Also, through a hosting company for our website, we may collect certain additional information from you as a visitor to our website, such as Internet addresses and browser version and type. This information may be logged by us or our hosting company to help diagnose technical problems, and to administer the website in order to improve the quality of our service. We may also track and analyze non-identifying information and aggregate usage and volume statistical information from our visitors and customers and provide such anonymous statistical information to third parties. It may not be readily apparent that this information is being collected. If you would like to find out more about the privacy practices of our hosting company, please contact us using the contact information provided below and we will provide you with the name of, and contact information for our current hosting company. With your permission, we may use your contact information to send you information about Primo and related products and services. You can always opt-out of these communications.

Opting Out of Information Collection  
Our website allows visitors to opt-out of receiving communication when we request Personal Information from you, or through other means as identified. You may opt-out of providing Personal Information by simply not providing such information or by discontinuing the use of our website, or those portions of our website that require you to submit Personal Information. To ensure immediate removal from any of our electronic mailing lists, follow the specific instructions outlined within the communication you receive from us. If, however, you are unable to complete the process described in the communication, please send a copy of the undesired email to the address below and state that you wish to be removed from the mailing list. You may review, update, modify or remove your Personal Information provided to us at any time. Simply mail a detailed request to the address below.

Usage Restrictions for Children  
The Primo website is not intended for persons under 13 years of age. Primo does not knowingly collect or intend to collect Personal Information from children through our website in any circumstance. Please do not allow children to provide such information or participate in any of our website programs. If you become aware that this has occurred, please contact us at the address below to request the deletion of that information.

Third Party Websites  
Primo may partner with retailers, manufacturers, or other companies at various times to provide expanded services to our website guests. As part of such a relationship, Primo may share with these companies the use of certain website functions and/or information, and our website may contain links to such partner's sites. Primo is not responsible for the privacy practices or the content of any third party websites. Primo website visitors that link to other websites from the Primo site will need to check the privacy and security policy statement of such third party websites in order to understand such third party's privacy and security policies.

Certain Disclosures of Personal Information  
If Primo sells or transfers part or all of its business assets, consumer information may be one of the business assets transferred as part of the transaction. Primo may disclose Personal Information in special cases when it believes that disclosure of this information is necessary to comply with or conform to the law or that such disclosure is necessary to protect the users of our website, the website itself, or the public. The Primo website may provide chat rooms, forums, message boards, and/or news groups to its users at various times. Please remember that, unless otherwise stated, any information you disclose in these areas becomes public information. Primo is not responsible for such disclosures. Please exercise caution.

Text A:
Privacy Policy

Last updated: May 2010 

Haymarket Media Inc. ("Haymarket") has created this privacy statement to demonstrate our firm commitment to protect your privacy and to fully disclose what information we collect and how we use it. Please note your use of our site is also governed by the Terms and Conditions of use. 

Information Collection and Dissemination 

General Principles 

  * In general, you may visit this Web site without identifying yourself or revealing any personal information. 
  * As you browse our Web site, the site collects log file, IP address of your computer, and other standard tracking data we use to evaluate site traffic and usage patterns. Such information is aggregated with tracking data from all site visitors. We will use the information to personalize the site according to your preferences based on the aggregated information. We also use the aggregated information to evaluate products and services we may offer to you. 
  * Some portions of this Web site may require you to give us personally identifiable information such as your name, job title, company, physical mailing address, e-mail address, telephone and fax numbers (Personal Information) and, if applicable, financial information such as your credit card information (Financial Information), for, without limitation, (i) registration for attendance at certain Haymarket trade shows, conferences and events; and (ii) subscriptions to our publications. If you communicate with us by e-mail, post messages to any of our chat groups, bulletin boards or forums, or otherwise complete online forms, surveys or contest entries, any information provided in such communications may be collected as Personal Information. 
  * If you elect to provide us Personal Information, we use it primarily to deliver the service you requested. Other uses of Personal Information are described elsewhere in this Policy.
  * If you submit Financial Information, we use that information primarily to verify your credit and collect payments for your purchases, orders, registrations etc. 
  * Haymarket uses a third party to process credit card transactions and does not store financial information, such as credit card information on its website. We do retain the last four digits of the credit card number solely for customer service purposes. 



Information Sharing

Unless you opt-out, we share your Personal Information with Haymarket's affiliates and partners and third parties licensed to access your Personal Information by any of the foregoing. 

Except as otherwise provided in this Privacy Policy, we will keep your Personal Information and your Financial Information private and will not share it with third parties, unless such disclosure is necessary t (a) comply with a court order or other legal process; (b) protect our rights or property; or (c) enforce our terms of service. 

Several companies unaffiliated with Haymarket provide email deployment services for our email messages. The personally identifiable information, such as e-mail address, we provide to these vendors for the purposes of e-mail deployment is only used by them for that purpose and not for any other business activity. 

In order to comply with the Federal CAN-SPAM Act of 2003, we also may provide lists of customers who have opted-out of email promotion for Haymarket products to other companies, so they can be suppressed from mailings those companies send on Haymarket’s behalf. In addition, if you unsubscribe from a mailing we send to our own list on behalf of a third party, your removal instruction may also be supplied to the third party and added to their own suppression file. If you continue receiving email after opting out, please contact us at web@haymarketmedia.com. 

Aggregated information

We sometimes provide aggregated usage or tracking information collected from this Web site to third parties. 

Information on Children

As a business-to-business company, we do not knowingly collect information from children under the age of 13. On-line registration and web site usage is restricted to adults who are professionally engaged in the businesses we serve. 

Updating Visitor Information:

You have the option of accessing, correcting, updating and modifying your Personal and/or Financial Information, or visitor profile, at any time and as often as desired. If you desire to delete your Personal and/or Financial Information please contact us at web@haymarketmedia.com. 

Update Your Newsletter Subscriptions

You can opt-in to newsletter mailing lists, or remove yourself (opt-out) at any time through the subscription management page (this page will display all of your newsletter subscriptions) or by following the instructions at the end of the newsletters you receive. Please allow 3-5 business days for changes to take effect. You can locate the subscription management page through the “Log In” link at the top right hand corner of the site. For Haymarket sites not offering the subscription management page, please send your email preferences to subscriptions@haymarketmedia.com. 

Update Your Print Subscription Information

You can correct or change your print subscription information by sending an email to subscriptions@haymarketmedia.com. Please allow 2-4 weeks for changes to take effect. 

Third Party and Affiliated Links:

Our Web sites contain external links to other Web sites including suppliers, advertisers and affiliates. We have no control over, and are not responsible for, the content of, or information gathered by, these other Web sites. We do not endorse any of these Web sites or the products or services associated with such Web sites merely because they are linked to our Web site. 

Haymarket Magazines, Seminars, Events, Sites and Other Publications and Services

As a Haymarket customer you can also expect to receive relevant email and postal offers for Haymarket publications, seminars, events, web sites and other services. From time to time we are also able to secure and offer to our customers specially-negotiated discounts and new products from other leading companies. If you would prefer not to receive such mailings in the future, you can change your preference via the subscription management page which can be located by using the “Log In” link at the top right hand corner of the site. For Haymarket sites not offering the subscription management page, please send your email preferences to subscriptions@haymarketmedia.com. 

Haymarket Events

Haymarket Events are produced for a variety of companies (Sponsors). All data collected during the registration of such events may be shared with those Sponsors. This data is governed by the individual Sponsor's privacy policy and may be used by the Sponsor for follow-up purposes. Please visit the Sponsor’s web site to review its privacy policy. Similarly, Haymarket events will have the same access to this data as the Sponsors, and this Privacy Policy continues to govern how Haymarket uses the data. For details on how event Sponsors use the information you provide, please contact the Sponsor directly.

If you have any questions, please contact Events@haymarketmedia.com.

Haymarket eSeminars

Haymarket eSeminars produces sponsored webcasts and online trade shows for a variety of Sponsors. All data collected during the registration for such events will be shared with those Sponsors. This data is governed by the individual Sponsor's privacy policy and may be used by the Sponsor for follow-up purposes. Please visit the Sponsor’s web site to review its privacy policy. Similarly, Haymarket eSeminars will have the same access to this data as the Sponsors, and this Privacy Policy continues to govern how Haymarket uses the data. For details on how eSeminar Sponsors use the information you provide, please contact the Sponsor directly.

Haymarket eSeminars also automatically receives and records information on our server logs from your browser, including your IP address, Internet connection speed, Internet connection duration, and Real Media and Windows Media player information. This is done in conjunction with our broadcast providers. Your data is collected and retained by our broadcast providers for the sole purposes of delivering eSeminars content appropriately, traffic reporting, and enabling re-registration for future events. In addition, our broadcast providers use cookie technology to identify you as a registered user of the eSeminars service.

If you have any questions, please contact eSeminars@haymarketmedia.com.

Email A Friend

If you choose to use our referral service to inform a friend about our Site, products, or services, we will ask you for your friend's name and email address. We will send your friend a one-time e-mail inviting them to visit the site. We may store this information for the purpose of sending this one-time e-mail and tracking the success of our referral program. Your friend may contact the us at web@haymarketmedia.com to have their information removed from our database. 

Online Ad Serving

We use third-party advertising companies to serve ads when you visit our Web site. These companies may use information (not including your name, address email address or telephone number) about your visits to this and other Web sites in order to provide advertisements about goods and services of interest to you. If you would like more information about this practice and to know your choices about not having this information used by these companies, click here:  http://www.networkadvertising.org/consumer/opt_out.asp

Cookies

A "cookie" is a bit of data sent by a Web site through the browser to the computer of the user visiting the site, and enables the site to return the results the browser expects. Haymarket uses temporary, session-specific cookies to ensure visits to its Web site are smooth and customized for the visitor. Such cookies allow us to provide a visitor's browser with information tailored to the visitor's preferences and needs. Haymarket also uses permanent or persistent cookies that remain on a visitor's computer after the visitor leaves a Haymarket Web site. 

If you do not want your browser to accept cookies, you can turn off the cookie acceptance option in the browser's settings. However, disabling the cookie support function of the browser will prevent our Web site from functioning properly and you may not be able to utilize fully all of the site's features and information. 

We use advertising companies to develop banner ads for our Web site. These ads may contain cookies. These companies collect cookies sent to your browser through the banner ads and we do not have control or access to this data. Information may be collected from a third party through the use of cookies and web beacons to measure website traffic. 

Pixel Tags

Like many web sites, Haymarket may also use pixel tags, also known as beacons, spotlight tags or web bugs, to improve our understanding of site traffic, visitor behavior, and response to promotional campaigns, as a supplement to our server logs and other methods of traffic and response measurement. Pixel tags are sometimes used in conjunction with small Javascript-based applications, also for the purpose of traffic measurement. We may also implement pixel tags provided by other companies, for the same purpose. You can disable pixel tags by changing your browser settings to omit images and disable Javascript; or there are commercial software packages available that can omit pixel tags and most advertisements. 

Opt-out Option

Visitors to this Web site can decide if they want to receive promotional information from Haymarket. On the visitor registration pages, prospective visitors can choose to request Haymarket not to e-mail them advertising and promotional information. Should visitors accept promotional e-mail from Haymarket, any e-mail they receive will include instructions on how to be removed from Haymarket's promotional e-mail list. If you continue receiving email after opting out, please contact us at web@haymarketmedia.com. 

Security and Encryption

This Web site takes commercially reasonable precautions to protect your information. When appropriate, we use SSL encryption technology on our Web site and a secure server to encrypt information transmitted between your browsers and our server. As a result, data you submit to our Web site such as credit card and payment information is transmitted using commercially reasonable security over the Internet. 

This Web site also uses password encryption to keep ensure your privacy when registering for newsletters, events, and other Haymarket related media.

Notification of Changes

Haymarket reserves the right, at any time and without notice, to add to, change, update or modify this Privacy Policy, simply by posting such change, update or modification on the Web site. Any such change, update or modification will be effective immediately upon posting on the Web site. Please check back often to review the latest version of our Privacy Policy.

Your Acceptance of these Terms

By using our Web site, products or services, you signify your acceptance of the terms of the Haymarket Privacy Policy. If you do not agree to the terms of the Haymarket Privacy Policy, please do not use the Web site, products and/or services and exit the site immediately.

Questions?

If you have any questions on our Privacy Policy, or complaints about our handling of your Personal and/or Financial Information, you can contact us at sitefeedback@haymarketmedia.com.
